text: hi everyone
Anthony Fantino here the Internet's
busiest music nerd and it's time for a
review Toro y Moi anything in return
Toro y Moi is the pseudonym for music
producer multi-instrumentalist singer
and songwriter Chaz bundok and musically
he's been involved in other projects but
everything that he's done just
popularity wise does not compare to Toro
y Moi even though I haven't really been
in love with any of the full lengths
that he's put out so far it has been
kind of interesting watching his
progression Chaz kind of came to
popularity in 2009 when a lot of artists
were being corralled underneath the
chillwave
label a single of his blessa was one of
the lead songs kind of defining the
genre getting people hyped up and
excited about this brand new genre that
many assumed would kind of overtake
music for much longer than it actually
did truth be told this chill wave
actually started to recede around the
time that Chaz released his first album
since he kind of became popular with
this label that was assigned to him and
even though it was highly anticipated
for me it was pretty underwhelming to me
this album had very little strength
outside of its singles or just the
tracks that were dropped prior to the
release of this thing it seemed to me to
be an album that was not really all that
interested in crafting an interesting
track or song it was really more just
enthralled with its wonky bedroom beat
production than anything which led to a
lot of tracks that kind of meandered
went nowhere sort of ended abruptly
weren't all that well developed felt a
little bit like filler a lot of people
disagree with me on this and have
disagreed with me on this in the past
but I just continue to feel this way
about causes of this now in 2011 taurima
quickly came out with another LP
underneath the pine and on this album
which I liked a bit more I actually
liked in general it seemed like chill
weight was on the bottom of the menu and
Chaz was embracing the worlds of synth
funk as well as disco on this thing and
these grooves felt carefully crafted
they
well crafted they were sexy they were
alluring
however from release to release vocals
have consistently been kind of either
met or just a turn-off for me for Toro y
Moi I can't really go as far as to say
that the vocals on his LPS are really
all that whiny I think whiny implies
like some kind of sense of intense
emotion whereas I don't really get that
from Chaz's vocals all too often they
may be light they may be kind of
high-pitched and just in that upper
register but I typically find them to be
a little OneNote kind of flat when it
comes to giving a convincing performance
that actually feels like he's conveying
some kind of I don't know happiness
sadness ambivalence I'm not sure because
so many of his vocal takes just sound
the same to me over and over and in one
song after another his voice to me just
sort of seems to fade into the

causes of this in songs that really sort

actually what kind of got me excited for

consistently not only that but overall
this is a longer album so I was kind of
hoping to hear maybe some sort of

are just an improved version of Chaz's
stick in general however I personally I

crafted pop torture device where the

likable to just ha the album starts off

just on top of them it just reminds me
